item.title: Need 2 tokens Per 12 Hr on Login
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“ravekitty, post:19, topic:446048”][quote author=hack3r link=topic=548906.msg4049495#msg4049495 date=1342373376]

public int totalPlaytime(){
                return (pTime / 2);}
        public void getst00f(){
                int DAY = (totalPlaytime() / 86400);
                int HR = (totalPlaytime() / 3600) - (DAY * 24);
                int MIN = (totalPlaytime() / 60) - (DAY * 1440) - (HR * 60);
                if(MIN == 10) {
                loyaltypoints += 100;
        }

Ive Tried putting it in i just get 100 errors, could you find me a exact position to place it? because ive tried four times… thanks
[/quote]
Put it ABOVE any method.
You probably tried to put it inside another method[/quote]
No. He needs another } at the end.

Edit: If he used an IDE he would know that

item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“kingman002, post:13, topic:446048”][quote author=hack3r link=topic=548906.msg4049402#msg4049402 date=1342364458]

why not put it in the playerfile? eg the variable c.timer = ###### for timer thing
and deduct in miliseconds… ive tried this but i get a big error when i try and remove from miliseconds.
anyone willing to help me i will be thankfull

IM ALSO LOOKING TO DO A 100 loyalty Points per 10 mins concecensive playing.
PLEASE COMMENT IF YOU CAN HELP ++REP

	public int totalPlaytime(){
		return (pTime / 2);}
	public void getst00f(){
		int DAY = (totalPlaytime() / 86400);
		int HR = (totalPlaytime() / 3600) - (DAY * 24);
		int MIN = (totalPlaytime() / 60) - (DAY * 1440) - (HR * 60);
                if(MIN == 10) {
                st00fs += 100;
	}

I just like pulled dat out of my azz
idk if it will work (.___. )

I dont understand this??

  1. where do i put it in client.java i assume?
  2. do i have to do any imports.

My edited version :

	public int totalPlaytime(){
		return (pTime / 2);}
	public void getst00f(){
		int DAY = (totalPlaytime() / 86400);
		int HR = (totalPlaytime() / 3600) - (DAY * 24);
		int MIN = (totalPlaytime() / 60) - (DAY * 1440) - (HR * 60);
                if(MIN == 10) {
                loyaltypoints += 100;
	}

HOW DO I MAKE IT SAY “YOU HAVE GOT 100 LOYALTY POINTS FOR PLAYING FOR 10 MINS Consistently” ??

Please help
++rep
[/quote]
I doubt you added Squeel of Fortune by your self.

Just use whatever you use to make it send a message to that player in the if(MIN == 20)[/quote]
Anywhere in client.java any errors you get you can fix yourself c:
And no you don’t need imports

either A) Squeal came with server source or B) You did it through tutorials. I'm calling bullshit on that you did it ALL by yourself otherwise you wouldn't be asking these questions
Stop trying to pick a fight.

item.source: Need 2 tokens Per 12 Hr on Login

item.title: Need 2 tokens Per 12 Hr on Login
item.dc:creator: @PvP_Bobby PvP Bobby
item.description:
@PvP_Bobby wrote:

This is actually a pretty simple thing to do… But there are some things that you have to think about.

Do you want it like…
Every single 12 hours of server-up-time everyone gets 2 tokens regardless of when they signed up
Every single 12 hours of play-time you get 2 tokens

Now there are a number of ways to do this.
IF you have MySQL working with your server do some research on CRON jobs with your website host.
IF you aren’t using MySQL… Start an event in the server for every 12 hours (43,200,00 ms) to cycle through all character files and add 2 tokens.

Read full topic

item.title: Need 2 tokens Per 12 Hr on Login
item.dc:creator: @Jake2008 Jake2008
item.description:
@Jake2008 wrote:

The only way to do this would be with a mysql database im pretty sure.

You would have to make it so each character gets a timer set, and on login it checks the database for their timer. Not really an easy thing to do =\

You could also do a cheap fix and put an auto restarter on the server every 24 hours and possibly reset everyones points when the server auto-restarts lol.

Read full topic
